text.p: Synopsis of Arrigo Sacchi's career in Italian soccer after he announced he was leaving the national team for AC Milan:
1946 - Born in Fusignano, eastern Italy, on April 1.
1972 - Quits job as a shoe salesman for his father's factory to take on his first coaching job, at Fusignano.
1980 - Joins Cesena as youth team coach.
1985 - Joins Parma after spells coaching at Rimini and Fiorentina's youth team.
1987 - Joins AC Milan after impressing owner Silvio Berlusconi when serie B Parma knocked Milan out of Italian cup.
1989 - Won European Cup and Italian Super Cup.
1990 - Won European Cup, European Supercup and Intercontinental Cup.
1991 - Won Intercontinental Cup and then appointed Italy national coach. Made his debut with a 1-1 draw against Norway on November 13 in Genoa.
1994 - Reached World Cup final in Los Angeles, losing to Brazil on penalties.
1996 - Took Italy to European championship finals in England, failed to progress beyond first round.
- November 6. Last match in charge of Italy, a 2-1
friendly defeat to Bosnia in Sarajevo.
- December 1. Quits as Italy coach to rejoin Milan.
